content.body: ljharb: essentially copy key-values from a map-like into this
content.formatted_body: ljharb: essentially copy key-values from a map-like into this

content.body: Kotlin has a similar method on their Map https://kotlinlang.org/api/latest/jvm/stdlib/kotlin.collections/-mutable-map/put-all.html
Yeah, we've had some requests for this for `URLSearchParams` (which is a multi-map, but looks quite similar in shape) and I rather not add something without standard library precedent
content.formatted_body: Yeah, we've had some requests for this for URLSearchParams (which is a multi-map, but looks quite similar in shape) and I rather not add something without standard library precedent

content.body: For arrays it seems you just do `push(...otherArray)` but that doesn't really scale to other collections
content.formatted_body: For arrays it seems you just do push(...otherArray) but that doesn't really scale to other collections

content.body: And that also doesn't scale with very large arrays as it blows engine's varargs limits
* And that also doesn't scale with very large arrays as it blows engine's varargs limits

content.body: That said Im more likely to concat and create a new array.
For the URLSearchParams case is it explicitly for mutating the map, as opposed to creating a copy?
The new Set.prototype.union for example is like a non-mutating extends (if one squints)
